blowout.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a sudden bursting of a tyre
blowout.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I had a blow-out on the driver’s side.
blowout.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a big expensive meal or large social occasion
blowout.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: We went for a real blow-out to celebrate.
blowout.translation[0].definitions[2].de: an easy victory over someone in a game
blowout.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a sudden uncontrolled escape of oil or gas from a well
blowout.translation[1].definitions[0].de: when a business fails or a financial market falls very quickly
blowout.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Bull markets always end in a speculative blowout.
blowout.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a very successful period of time for sales or profits
blowout.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Microsoft’s performance was slightly better than expectations, but it wasn’t a blowout quarter.
blowout.translation[1].definitions[2].de: in oil exploration, when pressure from under the ground causes oil to flow in an uncontrolled way
blowout.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: a platform blowout that spilled thousands of barrels of oil into Santa Barbara Channel
